result.execSummary:
The defendant Dezmond A Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cts 1-3: Balance ($200 bail applied) of fine/costs due by payment plan of $80.00 a month beginning 6/17/16. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25.00 owed.
On 7/7/16 Court approves release for work search and huber.

Court orders weapon be forfeited. 
Defendant to submit to DNA sample forthwith.

Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges

Guilty (3)

5/24/2016 Trial    Exhibit 1 located in Exhibit Room Safe  Paper exhibits destroyed as of 12/01/2018.

Defendant colloquy A Howard in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties ready to proceed. Court gives sequestration order. 
8:55am Court stands in recess for jury clerk to confirm 2 jurors listed have had civil rights have been restored.
9:10am In session, same appearances. Court advises the 2 jurors have had their rights restored. 
9:12am Jury panel brought in and sworn; 18 jurors called to the box.
9:19am Court's Voir Dire.
9:28am State's Voir Dire.
9:41am Defense's Voir Dire.
9:45am Jury striking.
9:51am Jury of 12 selected; remaining jury panel thanked and excused.
9:59am Jury sworn. Court gives preliminary jury instructions. 
10:10am Jury out for morning recess. Court in session, record made regarding the jury striking/selection. (Court will create a "re-do" of the Jury Selection & Prempt Challenges document for clarification)
10:14am Court in recess.  
10:25am Jury brought in.
10:28am Opening statement by State.
10:37am Opening statement by Defense.
10:43am Officer Dudash sworn and testified.
11:10am Analyst J. Z. sworn and testified. 
11:20am Officer J. Kell sworn and testified.
11:27am Sgt. S. Yanke sworn and testified.
11:32am In recess.
11:36am In session outside jury's presence. 
11:42am Jury brought in.
11:44am Deputy J. Byrnes sworn and testified.  State rests. 
11:49am Jury excused for lunch break until 1:25pm. Court remains in session conducting jury instruction conference.
12:10pm Court in recess until 1:30pm
 1:22pm In session, outside jury's presence. Defendant indicates he will testify, court gives colloquy. Recess for defendant to confer with counsel.
 1:33pm In session. Defendant confirms he will testify. 
 1:54pm Jury brought in. Defendant sworn and testified.
 1:58pm Jury out, court in session outside their presence.
 2:13pm Jury brought in. Continued testimony by defendant. No further witness by defense. No rebuttal. 
 2:25pm Jury out, court in session outside their presence.
 2:38pm Jury brought in. Jury instructions given by the Court.
 2:52pm Closing argument by State.
 3:01pm Closing argument by Defense.
 3:06pm Rebuttal by State.
 3:11pm Remaining jury instructions given by Court.
 3:17pm Jury out for deliberations. Court stands in recess.
 3:26pm Jury brought in with verdicts of:  Count 1- Guilty  Count 2- Guilty   Count 3- Guilty.
 3:30pm Jury thanked and excused. States requests judgment on the verdict. Defense requests judgment not withstanding the verdict. Court will grant request for judgment on the verdict. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State gives recommendation. Statement by defense. Court renders sentence. Defendant remanded into custody.

Defendant Dezmond A Howard in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties ready to proceed with jury trial. Defense indicates defendant is requesting new counsel. Court orders defendant to meet with Atty Jansen immediately following hearing and the Court will recall case after meeting is completed. Court advises defendant failure to attend meeting is in violation of his bail conditions.
9:44am Case recalled, same appearance. Counsel makes motion to dismiss based on jurisdiction. Response by State. Court denies motion. Matter to proceed on 5/24/16 for jury trial.

Status hearing on May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Jury instructions to be filed by 5/16/16. Defense witness list to be filed by 5/6/16.

Defendant Dezmond A Howard in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance with defendant stating he has not been able to contact defendant prior today's hearing. Counsel advises defendant will not communicate with him.  Counsel will need to request copies of discovery discs from DA's office, defendant indicates he is not in receipt of them. Defendant Dezmond A Howard in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz. Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel indicates there has been a breakdown of communication with the defendant. Defendant is waiving his right to an attorney. The Court is not confident the defendant is able to represent himself and will not allow withdrawal of counsel. Case to be recalled.

11:34am Case recalled, same appearances. Counsel requesting again to withdraw. Court will allow for new appointment thru public defender's office and allows Atty Alme-Boaz to withdraw. State requesting increase of cash bail to $2500   based on inconsistent statements by defendant. Court modifies conditions only: Def to report every Mon. at 9am beginning 4/4/16 until trial date.  Deputy to log that he appeared as ordered.

State appears by Attorney Adam Gerol. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Defendant qualifies for Public Defender. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 cash bail with conditions. Court orders $200 cash bail with conditions: not to possess any firearms,  not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
